movies.title: And Soon the Darkness
movies.plot: Jane and Cathy, two English women in their early twenties, are on a cycling tour. While traveling in rural France, they begin to disagree about the route. Cathy would prefer to take things in at a leisurely pace, while Jane is trying to stick to strict schedule. After arguing, they part ways. When her friend fails to rejoin her, Jane begins to worry and returns to the last place she saw her. Cathy has vanished. Alone and with a limited knowledge of French, Jane doesn't know who to trust as she frantically searches for her missing friend.
movies.simplePlot: Two young English women go on a cycling tour of the French countryside. When one of them goes missing, the other begins to search for her. But who can she trust?

biography.bio: British actress Pamela Franklin has worked with many notable actors and directors throughout her career. A somewhat underrated actress, she had a wide range of emotions that she brought to her many versatile characters. Franklin was born in Yokohama, Japan, and her father was an importer/exporter. She initially studied dance at the Elmhurst School of Ballet in England (now the Elmhurst School for Dance). She made her film debut at age 11 as "Flora" in The Innocents (1961) alongside Deborah Kerr and a year later appeared as "Tina" in The Lion (1962) with William Holden and Trevor Howard. She has worked with many directors including Ronald Neame, Jack Clayton, and John Huston. Franklin is most remembered for her performance as the rebellious "Sandy" in the The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie (1969) which starred Maggie Smith and also as the hapless kidnap victim in The Night of the Following Day (1968) in which she appeared with Marlon Brando and Rita Moreno. Franklin later carved out a niche as a "scream queen" in a handful of 1970s horror features. She portrayed the psychic medium in The Legend of Hell House (1973) which also featured Roddy McDowall. For many years, Franklin made several guest appearances on hit TV shows. In the early 1970s, she married actor Harvey Jason whom she met on the set of Necromancy (1972) and had two children. Franklin retired from acting in the early 1980s.
biography.name: Pamela Franklin

biography.bio: Michele Dotrice was born on September 27, 1948 in Cleethorpes, Lincolnshire, England. She is an actress, known for Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em (1973), And Soon the Darkness (1970) and The Blood on Satan's Claw (1971). She was previously married to Edward Woodward.
biography.name: Michele Dotrice

biography.bio: Sandor Elès was born on June 15, 1936 in Budapest, Hungary as Sandor Jozsef Eles. He was an actor, known for Love and Death (1975), Countess Dracula (1971) and The Evil of Frankenstein (1964). He died on September 4, 2002 in Kilburn, London, England.
biography.name: Sandor Elès

biography.bio: John Nettleton was born on February 5, 1929 in London, England. He is an actor, known for A Man for All Seasons (1966), Oliver Twist (2005) and Longitude (2000).
biography.name: John Nettleton

biography.bio: Clare Kelly was born on February 25, 1922 in Manchester, Lancashire, England. She was an actress, known for Georgy Girl (1966), And Soon the Darkness (1970) and The Cuckoo Waltz (1975). She died on February 18, 2001 in Bath, Somerset, England.
biography.name: Clare Kelly

biography.bio: Hana Maria Pravda was born on January 29, 1916 in Prague, Bohemia, Austria-Hungary as Hana Beck. She was an actress, known for The Man Who Cried (2000), The Unbearable Lightness of Being (1988) and And Soon the Darkness (1970). She was married to George Pravda and Alexandr "Sasha" Munk. She died on May 28, 2008 in Oxford, Oxfordshire, England.
biography.name: Hana Maria Pravda

biography.bio: John Franklyn is an actor, known for The Abominable Dr. Phibes (1971), And Soon the Darkness (1970) and The Hole in the Wall (1955).
biography.name: John Franklyn

biography.bio: Claude Bertrand was born on March 24, 1919 in Greasque, Bouches-du-Rhône, France. He is known for his work on Tintin et le temple du soleil (1969), The Twelve Tasks of Asterix (1976) and Chloe in the Afternoon (1972). He died on December 14, 1986 in Montpellier, Hérault, France.
biography.name: Claude Bertrand

biography.bio: Jean Carmet was born on April 25, 1920 in Bourgueil, Indre-et-Loire, France as Jean Gabriel Edmond Carmet. He was an actor and writer, known for Germinal (1993), Buffet froid (1979) and Black and White in Color (1976). He died on April 20, 1994 in Sèvres, Hauts-de-Seine, France.
biography.name: Jean Carmet
